definitions.definition: To remove something from a wall or similar vertical surface to which it is fixed.
definitions.example: He took down the picture and replaced it with the framed photograph.

definitions.definition: To remove something from a hanging position.
definitions.example: We need to take down the curtains to be cleaned.

definitions.definition: To remove something from a website.
definitions.example: We must take this fake news item down today.

definitions.definition: To write down as a note, especially to record something spoken.
definitions.example: If you have a pen, you can take down my phone number.

definitions.definition: To remove a temporary structure such as scaffolding.
definitions.example: When everything else is packed, we can take down the tent.

definitions.definition: To lower an item of clothing without removing it.
definitions.example: The doctor asked me to take down my trousers.

definitions.definition: To arrest someone or to place them in detention.
definitions.example: We've got enough evidence now to take McFee down.

definitions.definition: (of a person) To crush; to destroy or kill.
To force oneâ€™s opponent off their feet in order to transition from striking to grappling in jujitsu, mixed martial arts, etc.
To collapse or become incapacitated from illness or fatigue.
